reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Continuing Pileated Gibbon Conservation Education and Public Outreach in Cambodia through the Kouprey Express

description.narrative: The project will accomplish the following objectives: (1) Continue building capacity and understanding of key environmental issues for 300 teachers, community educators, and community leaders in communities, schools and NGOs in target areas as well as all other provinces through training, staff development, monitoring and evaluation; (2) Bring a gibbon-focused education curriculum to an estimated 7,500 students at national schools and NGOs around the country and in the Cardamom Mountains; (3) Conduct an anticipated 20 field trips to Phnom Tamao Wildlife Rescue Center to complement classroom lessons and environmental education awareness outreach activities for students and community members from around the country; (4) Build environmental awareness and pride in Cambodia’s natural heritage among students and communities through interactive hands-on Community Night Shows, which complement our work in schools; (5) Continue collaboration with other conservation NGOs on capacity building to help facilitate their own environmental education teams as a means of ensuring our message continues; (6) Continue to conduct Wildlife ID and anti-smuggling training with new Customs and Excise officers from Phnom Penh and Siem Reap International Airports and other relevant agencies; and, (7) Raise community awareness among Cambodians on a nationwide level regarding the devastating effects of the illegal wildlife trade with a focus on gibbons, destruction of habitats, and other factors threatening Cambodia’s wildlife through large-scale signage and outreach activities in collaboration with others.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Through partnerships with the Cambodian government, civil society, and the private sector, the United States aims to improve regional security and help the Cambodian people by addressing a broad spectrum of needs. The United States foreign policy priorities for Cambodia are to support the development of sustainable democratic institutions, foster respect for human rights, promote broad-based, sustainable economic growth, reduce food insecurity, and increase access to quality healthcare. In the run-up to the 2017 commune council elections and the 2018 parliamentary elections, the U.S. government is focusing on promoting political competition, strengthening civil society, and fostering transparency in election administration. After 20 years of economic growth, Cambodia is poised to join the ranks of the world's lower-middle income countries, but inequality and corruption still limit economic opportunities for the country's rural majority. Despite impressive achievements in reducing maternal mortality and expanding access to HIV treatment, health and nutrition challenges remain. Inadequate education and poor literacy rates are an impediment to sustainable growth. Porous borders facilitate transnational criminal activities. Programs supporting the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR), the Global Health Initiative (GHI), the President's Malaria Initiative (PMI), Feed the Future (FTF), and the Global Climate Change Initiative (GCCI) will further reduce health and human development constraints, improve food security and resiliency, help Cambodia adapt to climate change, and conserve the country's natural resources.
